mng: you (informal, as opposed to courteous 您[nin2])

exm.mng: you (informal, as opposed to courteous 您[nin2])
your, yours
Hello!, Hi!, How are you?
yourself
you (plural)
mini (as in mini-skirt or Mini Cooper) (loanword)
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries, two parties cannot coexist
my dear, my darling
you all (archaic), see also 你們|你们[ni3 men5]
miniskirt
mini model
How are you?, Are you well?
friendly one-upmanship, to try to emulate
lit. you fight, I snatch (idiom); to compete fiercely offering no quarter, fierce rivalry, tug-of-war
see 肏你媽|肏你妈[cao4 ni3 ma1]
fuck your mother (vulgar)

exm.cur: 你走你的阳关道，我过我的独木桥
exm.trd: 你走你的陽關道，我過我的獨木橋
exm.mng: you hit the high road, I'll cross the log bridge, you take the easy way, I'll follow the hard path
exm.pyn: nǐ zǒu nǐ de Yáng Guān dào , wǒ guò wǒ de dú mù qiáo

exm.mng: Bless you! (after a sneeze)
Bless you! (after a sneeze)
I love you (jocular transliteration from English)
